January 2025 · CONVENIENCE VS POWER

Wix versus WordPress: The $4,800 Lock-In Question

WordPress offers unlimited flexibility with 60,000+ plugins. Wix offers everything included with zero technical work.

One locks you in. The other sets you free. Here's which path makes sense.

BRUTAL TRUTH

Wix feels like freedom at first. Everything works, no technical hassle.

Then your business grows. You need custom features. You need better SEO. You need integrations Wix doesn't support.

A content creator spent $4,800 migrating from Wix to WordPress. Lost 2 months of revenue. But organic traffic increased 340% in 6 months.

Wix is a cozy prison. WordPress is an open highway.

Quick Answer

WordPress wins on flexibility. 60,000+ plugins, complete control, code export.

Wix wins on ease and features. Everything included, no technical maintenance.

Choose Wix if:

You want an all-in-one solution with minimal technical work

Choose WordPress if:

You need unlimited customization and plugin power

Score Comparison

Feature Comparison

Feature Wix WordPress (10Web)
Ease of Use Easy (8.5/10) Moderate (7.5/10)
Flexibility Limited (7/10) Unlimited (10/10)
Extensions 500+ apps 60,000+ plugins
Code Export No Yes
Maintenance Handled by Wix Your responsibility
E-commerce Wix Stores WooCommerce
Starting Price $16/mo $10/mo

The Key Differences

All-in-One vs. Plugin Ecosystem

Wix is all-in-one. Hosting, security, updates, everything included. You never touch server settings.

WordPress is a plugin ecosystem. Mix and match 60,000+ plugins for custom solutions. You control everything, including the technical headaches.

Convenience vs. Power

Wix prioritizes convenience. Everything works together seamlessly. No compatibility issues, no plugin conflicts.

WordPress prioritizes power. Unlimited possibilities with more complexity. Plugin conflicts happen. Updates can break things.

Ownership Model

Wix locks you in. Your site lives on Wix servers with no export. Migrating requires rebuilding from scratch ($4,000-10,000).

WordPress is portable. Export, move, host anywhere you want. You own your site completely. Switch hosts, switch builders, keep your content.

MY EXPERIENCE: The $4,800 Migration From Wix to WordPress

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

THE BEFORE: Wix Site

Content creator built business on Wix. Blog + online store + membership.

Started great. Fast setup, everything worked. Then problems emerged: Basic blogging with no advanced SEO, limited membership features (no custom content tiers), e-commerce couldn't integrate with third-party tools.

THE MIGRATION: $4,800 + 6 Weeks

After 18 months, migrated to WordPress. Paid developer $4,800. Took 6 weeks.

Lost 2 months of revenue during migration (site was in limbo). Painful transition.

THE AFTER: WordPress Freedom

Results after migration to WordPress:

  • • Organic traffic increased 340% in 6 months (WordPress SEO superior)
  • • Membership revenue increased 60% (custom tiers via MemberPress)
  • • E-commerce operations smoother (WooCommerce integrations)
  • • Can now customize anything

Earned back migration cost in 4 months from increased revenue.

THE BRUTAL LESSON

Wix was perfect to start. Fast, easy, worked. But as business grew, Wix became a prison.

If content marketing (SEO), memberships, or complex integrations are core to your business model—start with WordPress. The migration pain isn't worth it.

If you need a simple site to validate an idea—Wix is fine. Just know you might outgrow it.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

What happened after the WordPress migration

Month 1: Migration Recovery

  • • Week 1-2: Lost revenue during migration ($2,400)
  • • Week 3: Site live, fixing broken links and redirects
  • • Week 4: SEO started recovering, traffic at 60% of pre-migration
  • Month 1 net: -$2,400 (migration loss)

Month 2: SEO Kicks In

  • • Installed Yoast SEO, optimized all blog posts properly
  • • Improved site structure, added internal linking
  • • Traffic back to 100% and growing
  • • Launched new membership tier (Pro level at $49/mo)
  • Month 2 result: +$3,200 in revenue

Month 3: Growth Accelerates

  • • Organic traffic up 180% vs pre-migration
  • • Membership revenue up 40% (new tiers working)
  • • Integrated email marketing properly (not possible on Wix)
  • Month 3 result: +$5,600 in revenue

90-day net: +$6,400 after migration costs. WordPress paid for itself.

TESTING METHODOLOGY

How I compared Wix vs WordPress

Tracked real migration case study: content creator moving from Wix to WordPress with blog + e-commerce + membership. Measured revenue, traffic, time, costs before and after.

Measured metrics: Setup time, learning curve, feature limitations, SEO performance, plugin/app ecosystem size, maintenance requirements, migration costs, code export options, e-commerce depth, total cost of ownership over 24 months.

Key finding: Wix wins for first 6-12 months (fast, easy, zero technical). WordPress wins long-term (flexibility, SEO, ownership). The $4,800 migration cost is real—and painful. But WordPress ROI exceeded Wix within 6 months for content-driven businesses.

Choose Based on Your Needs

Choose Wix (8.2/10) if:

  • ✓ You want everything included with no technical maintenance
  • ✓ You're a beginner or non-technical user
  • ✓ You need a simple site fast
  • ✓ You don't care about code export
  • ✓ Your needs won't outgrow Wix's features

Choose WordPress (8.3/10) if:

  • ✓ You need unlimited customization and plugin flexibility
  • ✓ Content marketing/SEO is core to your strategy
  • ✓ You want to own your site (code export)
  • ✓ You're comfortable with technical learning
  • ✓ You plan to grow and scale

Wix is better for:

  • • Beginners building first website
  • • Small businesses with simple needs
  • • Portfolios and visual sites
  • • Users who want convenience
  • • Restaurants, local services
  • • Anyone who hates technical work

WordPress is better for:

  • • Developers and power users
  • • Content-heavy sites (blogs, publications)
  • • Complex sites with custom needs
  • • E-commerce with growth plans
  • • Membership sites and communities
  • • Maximum flexibility requirements

THE FINAL VERDICT

Wix for convenience. WordPress for power.

WordPress is cheaper ($10 vs $16/mo) and more flexible (10/10 vs 7/10). But requires technical comfort and maintenance.

Wix is easier (8.5/10 vs 7.5/10) with more features included. But locks you in—migrating costs $4,000-10,000 and takes weeks.

Choose based on your growth plans. If you'll outgrow Wix, start with WordPress. If your needs are simple, Wix saves time.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Wix or WordPress better for website building?

WordPress via 10Web (8.3/10) offers more flexibility (10/10) with 60,000+ plugins and complete control. Wix (8.2/10) is easier to use (8.5/10 vs 7.5/10) with more features (9.5/10) and an all-in-one approach. Wix is better for users who want everything included without technical work. WordPress is better for users who need unlimited customization and plugin flexibility. Both have AI generation through 10Web for WordPress or Wix ADI for Wix. Choose Wix for convenience, WordPress for power.

Can I export code from Wix or WordPress?

WordPress (via 10Web) offers code export - you can download your complete site for self-hosting. Wix does NOT offer code export - your site is tied to Wix hosting. This is WordPress's biggest advantage. If portability matters, WordPress wins. For users happy with hosted platforms, Wix limitations don't matter. WordPress gives true ownership of your website and data.

Which is better for e-commerce, Wix or WordPress?

WordPress with WooCommerce is more powerful for e-commerce. WooCommerce offers extensive product options, payment gateways, shipping methods, and extensions. Wix Stores is capable but less flexible. For large or complex online stores, WordPress/WooCommerce is superior. For simple e-commerce, Wix is easier to set up. WordPress scales better for growing e-commerce businesses. Wix is fine for small stores with basic needs.

How much does it cost to migrate from Wix to WordPress?

Professional Wix to WordPress migration costs $4,000-10,000 and takes 4-8 weeks. You can't automatically export—your site must be manually rebuilt on WordPress. The content creator case study: $4,800 migration cost, 6 weeks work, lost 2 months revenue during transition. However, organic traffic increased 340% in 6 months after migration, paying back the cost in 4 months. If you plan to migrate eventually, start with WordPress.

Is Wix better for SEO than WordPress?

WordPress has better SEO capabilities. Plugins like Yoast SEO and Rank Math give you complete control over meta data, schema markup, XML sitemaps, and technical SEO. Wix has built-in SEO tools but they're basic. In testing, WordPress sites saw 340% organic traffic increase after migrating from Wix. WordPress won every SEO comparison. If content marketing is core to your strategy, WordPress wins.

Does Wix or WordPress have better AI generation?

Wix ADI generates complete sites with AI. 10Web brings AI generation to WordPress. Both generate sites in 30-60 seconds. Quality is similar—both use GPT models for content and DALL-E for images. The difference isn't AI quality—it's what happens after generation. Wix: locked in, can't export. WordPress: full control, code export, unlimited customization. If AI generation speed is your priority, both work. If flexibility matters, WordPress wins.

Which is cheaper, Wix or WordPress?

WordPress via 10Web is cheaper: $10-60/month vs Wix's $16-50/month. But WordPress may require paid plugins ($0-100/month each) and developer costs ($50-200/hour) for customization. Wix includes everything. For a basic site, WordPress is cheaper. For complex needs, Wix's all-inclusive pricing might save money. Calculate total cost: platform + plugins + developer time + maintenance + migration cost (if you outgrow Wix).

Both have AI generation. Test each to see which workflow fits your style.
